text: This place is amazing! Tons of food for the price and the fried ice cream is to die for. I would highly recommend.

Went tonight with my husband. Chips and salsa were brought to the table quickly. The chips were good, not too thick and they came in a nice-sized bowl which is good because refills of the bowl cost $4. I have never been to a Mexican restaurant where extra chips cost money. I happen to love chips and salsa but I'm not paying $4 for it. The salsa was chunky and spicy without being so much so that I couldn't eat it (I'm pretty wimpy when it comes to spice!). I should mention that we were thinking about ordering nachos to share as an appetizer but the cost came to almost $20 for a full order with add-ons of beans, jalapenos, and chicken or steak. I guess the $11 nachos by themselves is just chips with cheese? I get the upcharge for meat but who charges for beans and jalapenos? We decided against it. Both hubby and I ordered fajitas. He got the steak fajitas (the menu said marinated) which the waitress told us was tri-tip. I got the chicken. We ordered them well done. I like well-done meats and I especially love my vegetables well-done to blackness. The fajitas come with soup (noodle or albondigas soup which is a vegetable soup with meatballs) or salad, rice and beans, sour cream and guacamole for $16.29. My husband got the salad. The salad was very small. It came on a plate that at another restaurant would be the bread plate. He got blue cheese dressing and said it was good but nothing special. I LOVE albondigas soup so I got that. The soup came in a bowl which was much larger in comparison to the salad plate. Weird proportions. The soup looked great but had very little flavor. Another big disappointment. Finally, we got our fajitas. They were cooked perfectly! The vegetables were blackened and both the steak and chicken were well-done. I was very pleased by this because I order well-cooked vegetables at EVERY Mexican restaurant and they are seldom cooked the way I like. I couldn't wait to eat! Unfortunately, this was the next BIG disappointment and the one that means I won't be going back. The meats and vegetables, while cooked perfectly were not seasoned AT ALL! The whole point of fajitas is the fajita seasoning. Remember the menu said "marinated?" I know because we checked after tasting our food. If that steak was marinated, then I'd hate to taste the unmarinated meat! The steak tasted like dried out liver. Yeah, we asked for it well-done so dry is a risk we take but liver-flavor? No, it sure did not taste like tri-tip to me! It was so flavorless, we asked for A1 steak sauce to make it edible! The chicken was marginally better but again no seasoning. The sour cream and guacamole came in a small bowl but there seemed to be a good-sized portion of each and the guac was tasty even though I didn't see any chunks of tomato or onion. No cheese came with the fajitas which was surprising. The rice, and refried beans were standard. I don't happen to like either so I can't speak to how good, or not, they were. I almost gave the place two stars for the way they cooked the fajitas but I just couldn't do it because the flavor was so lacking. The service was fine. The waitress was prompt in taking our order but we didn't see her again until we got our check. However, we had at least three other staff members do our bidding- fill our water glasses, give us napkins, bring the steak sauce, etc. - so we didn't feel the loss. I'm sad that I can't find fajitas that are flavorful and cooked the way I like. My search continues. El Burrito is definitely crossed off the list of places to revisit!

On my LAST and FINAL trip had bought a groupon and had decided to take my mother there. I had ordered 2 rolled tacos ( al a carte) my mom a chili relleno ( al a carte) both approx $6 each and a chimichanga (al a carte) to go approx $10. The manager /owner was very cold and couldn't  seemed to be bothered. My rolled tacos were average and when he dropped off the plate of a flat chili relleno had not warned my mother how SCOLDING HOT the plate was! When she tried to move her plate closer she actually burned her fingers. I almost didn't believe how hot it was when I touched it myself. What was crazy was the owner/ manager actually heard her say "Ouch" and just looked then just walked away! 
The relleno was flat and bland my (2) rolled tacos were like "minis" and for the price we were both very disapointed. The chimichanga was for my father to go and when we brought it home for him he actually took about 3 bites and couldn't eat anymore. Said it was pretty disappointing and bland as well. 
   HERE IS THE KICKER ... The owner/ manager actually had the guts to charge my mom and I a "mandated" gratuity of approx 18%! My husband and I have purchased a couple of groupons for this particular restaurant and had never been charged this before. ALSO looking at the fine print it had said alcohol and gratuity not included. No where did it say there would be an additional charge of over 18%! When I got the bill and it was almost 10$ higher.. I asked him to come back over and what the charge was ? He told me that this was mandatory and had always been charged for groupons. I told him I had never been charged this before and he actually told me I was wrong and should have been charged. As I had bought it on my phone I actually had the fine print right there and had read him where it said alcohol and gratuity not included. He started to argue and be very rude to me as I was asking to see where it said I had to pay this ? ( please don't get me wrong it's not tipping i believe in its over tipping ... Especially as I am in the tipping business myself) then he was very snide and said well ill take it off this time, and that he had to call groupon and make sure that they add it to the fine print when he couldn't "find" when he grabbed my phone and looked as well!  Really ? You're telling and treating a customer like this ? Basically trying to  make me feel like I was crap.. And was doing this right in front of my mother ( she had never been before) when he walked away to adjust the bill my mother was shocked and couldn't believe the audacity of how this owner / manager was treating us! I HAD BEEN A CUSTOMER FOR A WHILE NOW AND OVER LOOKED DECLINING SERVICE AND FOOD AS I LIKE TO PATRON " MOM AND POP PLACES" . FORGET IT ! WILL NEVER EVER GO BACK AND HAVE TOLD  MANY PEOPLE WHAT HAD HAPPENED. They also had seemed to have had similar experiences and had stopped going to El Burrito as well.  I will NOT BE BACK AND DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE !  THE OWNER / MANAGER IS AWEFUL AND THE FOOD SUCKS NOW! Especially for the prices. Not to mention it was 5 and we were the only two people in there ! DON'T GO!

Surprised there are no reviews for this place!

I have to lay down my love for this little shop because it was the place where I lost my fried ice cream virginity to what is the most amazing dessert (that isn't melted damnit) on the planet. Fried Ice Cream is a ball of vanilla ice cream covered in crispy batter with Cinnamon and sugar, sat in a giant tostada and covered with chocolate sauce. It is amazing. It is sinful. It is NOT MELTED ICE CREAM. 

Chips and salsa is not unlimited though it used to be (sorry a lot of Las Vegas restaurants have been having trouble this year I think, a LOT of places closed due to the economy). Lunch is only 7.75 for a choice of like 15 different things. Nothing on the dinner menu is more than 15 except for a 12oz New York Steak. 

I really like to get Chimichangas here, they are super fried and awful for you but delicious. Full of meat, full of goodness. Great place to go if you are up in the Summerlin area, where real Mexican that hasn't been co-opted by giant Americanizing corporations is few and far in between. It's in a little plaza that can be hard to find, but worth it. It will look like you are going into Vegas's own giant old-people community -- because you are, but make a sharp turn right into the plaza before that happens -- otherwise beware the golf cart!

Tonight we visited El Burrito with my husband and another couple. It looked really dark and empty from the outside, but inside was bright and the booths on the parameter were full. Decor is simple and restaurant is smallish. We got seated in a clean roomy booth by the kitchen.

The chips served are warm and thick and crunchy, and the salsa fresh and full of chopped tomatoes, and of a medium heat. Very tasty!

Ordered the soup- friends agree while very good, it was rather strange. It's beef based macaroni soup with cilantro and they add a whole pile of cheese on the bottom. Watching them eat it was like watching them eat pizza- cheese strings!

I ordered huevos rancheros, and they were pretty good, a bit watery somehow but the flavor was there with the beans so I'd get them again. Friends got the fajita salad and the beef chimichanga and the portions were  huge! The chimichanga beef was perfect, medium rare and tender. She asked for some pico de gallo and the waitress said they didn't have any but would be happy to make some. It came out fresh, spicy and full of cilantro. The salad was stuffed to the brim with veggies and the marinated chicken was tender. Husband asked for a pork tamale/taco combo not on the menu and they made it without hesitation. He says it was amazeballs... And the tamale was awesome and not dry. Getting a description from him is like puling teeth, so husband, one star.

Overall the service was a fast and friendly and the food was all enjoyable. It seems like a place you can frequent and they will get to know you. A quality locals joint for an easy and tasty weeknight meal out at a reasonable price.

Group consensus was 3.5 stars, but I rounded up because of the friendly local atmosphere. If you come here with the right expectations you will leave here with a full belly and a smile.

In a nut shell:  the food is decent, but, it's the spotty service that prevents us from EVER returning.  We've given this place so many chances for our business, since 1997, as it's so close to our house, but the service sucks. The owner's son does not have his head and heart in the business, and he sure likes to BS with his favorite customers and neglects and is forgetful of his other customers. About a month ago, (our last and final visit), we sat and waited for  someone to take our order, 3 servers passed our table, including the owner's son, then he went to his friend's table and proceeded to hug them and BS with them while we waited. Based on our previous experiences, we knew we were going to have a bad service meal, and so, we just got up and left. We decided  to go to Pin Keow (Thai), and once seated, within 30 seconds, we were giving our order. What a difference !!!

Adios, El Burrito, we'll never dine with you, ever again !!!!!

Really good food, and excellent Margaritas ! The prices were reasonable. My wife had a killer Chimichunga, and my green burrito was very good. It's a bit of a Dive- but dive right in ! We live in Sun City Summerlin and ate happy to have a good Mexican option here!

Just came here after a 10 day all inclusive vacation in Mexico where I was deprived of good Mexican food. I was hoping el burrito would live up to my expectations of delicious enchiladas, nachos, quesadillas and fajitas. I am STUNNED at how delicious my meal was. The group got nachos and a chicken quesadilla to start, then I shared chicken and steak fajitas along with the enchilada plate that comes with rice and beans. It also comes with a soup or salad, and I got the homemade noodle soup. I have never been so pleased with a meal... After getting mediocre Mexican food and coming here I absolutely refuse to go anywhere else.

This is the perfect location for an intimate date night or family get together. You will find parking very convenient and the food is incredible!
I ordered a shredded beef chimichanga and it exceeded my expectations. I had expected something on the smaller side but the portion was more than enough. I can't get over how delectable it was! The meat was cooked to perfection!! I also ordered a mojito which can make or break my decision on where I dine. ;)  It was delish and mojito's are my drink!! Yummmmy.. I will definitely return soon.

This is my sbsolute favorite restaurant!  Their chips and salsa is incredible. I recommend requesting the smooth salsa and mixing it with their ranch. The salad and soup are both crazy good. I have never had anything that I did not love at this restraunt.

Wow!!! I don't know what happened to el burrito, but when you can't even get the salsa right who's going to stick around to see if the dishes are any better. I mean come on, your salsa tasted like canned tomatoes dumped into a bowl with very little spices to give it that pop. Stuck around for our dishes and I wish I could say it was better. Nope, my chicken burrito was just that, chicken and a tortilla. No flavor once again, my wife did like her tacos though. So yeah pay 4.50 for a taco, no thank you. Won't be going back here again.

You know, me and my friends have been coming here for years and to us it's a classic and I love it. I don't care that maybe the food isn't "the best" mexican, to us it's epic.  I'm up for their chicken enchiladas and margaritas anytime.

Food is delicious, haven't been to any other Mexican restaurant that compares. Complementary chips and salsa are always a great plus. I don't usually drinks margaritas but I have to have one when I come here! Service is always quick and extra friendly.

I've passed El Burrito thousands of times, as I live nearby. However, I didn't discover its greatness until yesterday. Aside from their awesome Guacamole Burrito (I recommend Enchilada Style), the service was fantastic. The two that took care of us, were very nice and extremely attentive. It's not hard to see why El Burrito has been around almost as long as I have.  Anyway...I'll definitely be back!
Been there a few dozen times in the past 15 years. The soup is the best ever upgrade to a big bowl.  Prices are a but high and so are the drinks but that soup! On a cold rainy day. Mmmmm

Went here for dinner the other night with coworkers. We were all in the mood for nachos and margaritas after a long work week and El Burrito delivered that and more! We added beans and chicken to the nachos (definitely was a must) accompanied by several different margaritas. One thing that stood out above the food (which was delicious) was the service. I literally felt like it was my family serving on me, they treated us like we were their own. Our server Francesca, I believe, and the bartender Nancee recommended the perfect drinks and even got us to order more food than the nachos which we did not regret for a second. I've been watching what I eat lately and they accommodated that with "Skinny Girl" margaritas, strong and no sugar! My kinda drink. Don't listen to the previous reviews- this place is a must try

Had family in from Cali, place is close, love Mexican food, here goes.....

The food is not bad but is WAY sub par for the price. We had 7 in our party, but 3 were children under 5 years. Mexican food should not be that costly. But if it is,...it should be great. This just wasn't. Taco shells are store bought, beans are store bought. For the prices it should all be authentic. We had a $25 gift card from restaurant.com, now mind you you have to spend $45 at least to use the coupon and add 20% for the the tip. We all had Iced Tea, and the kids drinks came with their meals. We were done eating and waited 15 minutes for the bill. (Drum Roll)............$80 bucks?@#? Even with the gift card?!@#$?. If we didn't have the gift card it would've been over $100 with no booze for 4 Adults and 3 little ones. Good thing we didn't order a cocktail. Well, that does include tip. And I'll be honest, if the food was better, I wouldn't mind at all. But mexican food that is of MAYBE El Torito, Acapulco Restaurant quality, I was a little shocked.

The plus was the chips and salsa were great.

We tried, and as I said it was not bad, but I think they are too proud of their food.

My husband has been going to El Burrito for over 30 years. He started eating at the Decatur location which is now closed. He took me on a date there back in 1997 and we have been going ever since. Our two boys, now 12 & 14 absolutely love it. They recognize our faces and probably have our orders memorized as often as we go. The noodle soup is a must! The salsa is fresh and the special taco is a favorite. The staff is friendly and would recommend this place to anyone in the mood for some great Mexican food!

Crap food decent staff pricy for no good reason 
Never going back again
Location looks clean but just didn't taste any flavor on it.

I have been eating El Burrito since it was on Decatur, when we were all super young. That soup is soooo good. The macaroni soup. I used to ask the lady in the old restaurant for the recipe EVERY time. She was so nice, but not nice enough to hand it over. I found that several friends and family have tried to replicate, and fail. Myself, included. I also enjoy there chicken tacos. They wind up become a salad, for me, and that's cool. The cheese enchiladas are super yum. I always get the same things. But the soup? Always. And the staff? We adore the two young men that host and help out. They know there stuff. The only problem I've ever had is that the little space gets so packed! Well, it's my problem for going at prime hours, I supoose. These people can't help it if they freakin love the food! So just get it to go. I will, forever love this place, and if they ever decide to close, please giv me the recipe for the soup. Please.

Came here because I used to work in the area and was craving Mexican food one night. I ordered a burrito and some tacos and pretty much had to force myself to finish it. The chips that came with my meal were the only enjoyable part!

I like this place. We just ate there last night. Yum! I got a burrito enchilada stye (totally key if you want it in red sauce with tons of extra cheese :)) I got a bean and cheese burrito. They don't use lard in their beans for any of you vegetarians out there (vegetable oil they claim) and they were good. My hubby got the guacamole burrito with chicken and really enjoyed it. This place is definitely worthy or a return visit. The staff was nice and service was prompt. Plus, we had dinner for the two of us for $19 prior to tip -- which isn't bad for getting waited on :)
We love their chile rellenos so much that we come here from California just to have them! Minus one star for cleanliness and they usually don't open right when they are suppose to.
The best Mexican restaurant ever! Service is always amazing. The food is always delish.Must try the noodle soup with cheese. :))

This is my current favorite restaurant.  It's family-owned and close to home, which are important factors.  Yes, there is indeed a weird vibe, but I am weird, so perhaps that is why I like it so much.  Excellent chips and salsa, but the star of the show is the Cadillac margarita.  Trust me, I can drink with the best of them, but it takes only half of one of these drinks to get the job done.  Food tastes authentic and homemade.  I highly recommend the guacamole chicken burrito and the chicken machaca.  Shrimp fajitas are also yummy.   It is not cheap to dine at El Burrito, but I love it anyway, as the service and food have both been excellent.

Picked up a to go order for Mom. When I got home my chili relleno was hot they never forget my little bag of chips with salsa that comes with the meal. It's the best enchilada sauce in town. The noodle soup is hot very consistent. The shredded beef tacos are delicious

I probably eat at El Burrito more than any other restaurant other than The Omelette House at Lake Mead and Rampart.  The food is always hot, fresh and tasty.  You can order ala-carte which is what I usually do.  It is very reasonably priced and does a lot of business by word of mouth and it's longtime presence in Las Vegas.  I especially like the chicken tamales and cheese enchiladas with extra onions.  The noodle soup and salads are excellent starters as are the chips and guacamole.

been coming to el burrito for a year now, and unfortunately I am stopping. it was good food in the past, but has sharply declined in the last few months...

the food typically taste good. the biggest problem going on there is the service. I didn't understand what the problems were until recently. 

went there a few days ago and it was completely empty. sat down with wifey and kids, it took over 10 minutes, close to 15 to get order taken. drinks and refills, forget it. food came out, whatever, nothing special..was hot, but taste is just not there anymore.

refills on water wasn't possible. I didn't get it, makes no sense. the staff hides in the kitchen unless they need to bring you food.

the bus boys or runners, I don't know...just seem clueless. 

the problem is the servers. and recently I just found out they are related to the owner... perhaps that is the issue? family problems are affecting the business. if I was the owner, I would wake up and get rid of the family workers and get staff on there that actually care about the restaurant. or if your not interested in the business anymore, close up and move on.

sad to say i won't be going back, but that's just the way it is now. last few times service has been horrible, just not interested in it anymore.

good luck.

Thank god I found somewhere in Vegas with good Mexican food! Ask for Francesca as your server, she was so kind and recommended the perfect meal. I had the soup with cheese to start and the chicken fajitas- they were sizzling and tasted even better than they looked. (Ps the guacamole is the best I've had at any restaurant) the restaurant is definitely family owned, it's evident in the way they operate. Try the mango margarita!

This was recommended to me by a co-worker, which unless you know this place is here chances are you will not find it. The food was as expected, good Mexican fare. The chips were warm, salsa was homemade and the overall entrée selection was the basic combination of tortilla-meat-cheese. I would not say it is a 5 star place because the food did not blow me away, but the 4 star rating is because within a certain distance of sun city, this is the best Mexican you may fine. The atmosphere is a little odd, so don't bring a date, but the food is nice and you can taste the passion for the culture in the food.

My friend and I were on the hunt for some fried ice cream, the majority of the restaurants near us either closed early or were closed Sunday's. So we had the choice of eating here or at Coasta Cantina at the Suncoast. 

Walking in, there was no hostess, she was in the back and emerged to bring another customer her order, when she did acknowledge us, she was very friendly and proceeded to seat us, handed us the menus, and took our drink orders. Their website states they offer happy hour from 8 p.m. to close on Sunday's, but I can't confirm since there was no mention of it to us.

I took a look at the menu because I was craving ceviche but they did not have any, which was a bit of a let down because all of the Mexican restaurants I've visited have it. We just ended up ordering the dessert we originally came for, fried ice cream and also ordered some sopapillos. After we placed our order, the dessert came out around 5 minutes later. We took a look at our fried ice cream and were a bit thrown off. It looked pre-made, it was cold on the outside, no whipped cream, no cherry on top, and the texture was weird, it looked glazed, and came in a cinnamon shell. It was like no fried ice cream we've ever had, it's normally fried before it's brought out, so it's warm on the outside, cold on the inside, not here. Now for the sopapillos, they were not thick or fluffy enough, they did have good flavor since they were coated with cinnamon and sugar but it's a dessert that is very hard to screw up. After we received our order, no one came to check up on us, it took a little while to receive our checks so basic customer service was definitely lacking and there were only two other tables when we walked in. 

I was really disappointed. Overall we decided on this place because it was smaller and we thought, why not give our business to a mom and pop restaurant instead of a corporate company, but it was a mistake.

They had some of the worst customer service I have ever seen. After having drinks spilled all over our table, it all went downhill. The food was okay, but even the best food in town couldn't excuse their poor service.

Don't ever order from here. I ordered lunch using GrubHub and was very disappointed.  I did not receive what I ordered and the food I did receive did not look edible, not sure if it was beef or pork. Asked for beans, no beans.
Soooo good! The taco salad was awesome! My kids loved it too. Prices were reasonable and service was great!

Terrible customer service!!! The manager on duty argued with me about how their green chili was made. I sent back a green chili enchilada since no where on the menu did it say that pork would be in it. I am vegetarian and have no desire to eat meat. They came back with another cheese enchilada. Unbeknownst to me, they make their green chili with pork. I found pieces of pork in my food again. I told them thinking it was cross contamination or something. NO! He had told the kitchen to try and filter the pork out of the green chili. I TOLD HIM I WAS VEGETARIAN WHY WOULD I WANT PORK SOAKED GREEN CHILI?!?! That's when he argued telling me they tried to make it less pork containing. Could not believe the nerve of that guy! Will not return.

We love this place!! It's been our family spot for over 35 years!! The soup is the best and you can't visit this place without getting a bowl!! The guacamole shredded beef burrito enchilada style is never a wrong choice and it make it hard to try anything else on the menu because it's that good!

Cute little family owned place. Stopped by around 9pm and they were about to close, but still very accommodating to us. Started with the soup and salad, pretty good soup. I've never really had super authentic Mexican food, so I didn't know what to expect.

We got nachos to share as an appetizer... you can get half or full size, but since there was 3 of us, we got the full size and added beef. It was HUGE! And delicious. Barely had room for the main course afterwards, but it's okay. I enjoyed it quite a bit.

For the main course we had the guac burrito. Also very big, couldn't finish it. But it was pretty good I guess? Don't have much to compare to. Flavor is definitely better than at the chain mexican places, more "real" taste, but very rich and filling.

For dessert, which we were too full to have but I needed to try it, was the fried ice cream. Never had fried ice cream before.. so I was excited to try. It was good, but I definitely prefer tempura ice cream from japanese restaurants.

Great little place though. Nice friendly service. Food comes out relatively quickly. I would give it 3.5 stars, but sinec i can't I round down since I didn't feel super impressed.

I've been coming here for 15+ years and after watching this they have lost a loyal customer.

https://www.ktnv.com/news/dirty-dining/dirty-dining-imminent-health-hazard-closures-at-4-restaurants

I know the family, they're cool as ice! They're very welcoming, great food, always leave satisfied, very clean, and reasonably priced! Great for a party of 2, or 22, they accommodate always and never have an attitude problem with a request. Every waiter helps out if your water is empty, its filled promptly, as well as other drinks.

The chicken machaca was excellent as usual!  Only issue was the steak fajitas were too tough, tasty but tough. There was huge chunks of meat instead of thin strips. Francesca and Cassidy are always pleasant. Missed Nancy tonight. Will catch her next time. BONUS:  found out they have Albondigas Fridays thru Sundays!  Woohoo

El Burrito is by no means an authentic Mexican restaurant; that said it is a family owned cozy spot to have good food and great drinks. (one of my good friends is a producer for local news and lives clear across town but will call occasionally for a drink meeting)

My ex bf used to drive from Anthem to eat here, he's a Vegas native & guess at one time they had a second location on Decatur. Since it is located within Sun City, you will encounter lots of seniors (but can merely eat after 6pm to avoid that :) but it allows me to do one of my favorite things: drive golf cart to dinner/lunch. 

Though I'm not having Margaritas these days, the Cadillac packs a punch. The menu is standard Mexi-Merican and meals are accompanied by salad or soup & decent beans & rice. Salad is of the anemic iceberg variety which wouldn't bother me as much if the machacha chicken w guacamole salad wasn't my go to here. The house soup is comforting with beans and elbow noodles. 

I wish they offered more fish dishes here. One of my favorite light Mexican offerings is shrimp salsa w avocado cocktail. Most places will make it for me, even as an off menu item. No dice here, even when I was with aforementioned ex and this place was on our frequent rotation list. 

Aside from the limited menu options, service is very friendly and the owner is frequently working the room. Always feel welcome and well served here. 

Nowadays, I save it for a call from friends to catch up over drinks and apps or occasional lunch with Mom. There's a small Tuesday Morning in same strip mall and we always find tchotchkes in there. 

Wouldn't drive from Anthem for it, but he was a nutbag...

We have been going here for the last 14 years and have never had bad service. The restaurant is family owned and has great staff that have been around since we have been eating there. I always order the chicken fajitas and my son and husband order the cheese enchiladas I have tried many different items from the menu and loved everything I've tried. The chips and salsa are good too

We were ordering takeout and wanted to try a new Mexican food place. The prep time was not bad, unfortunately we were not too enthused about the food. I had the all meat green burrito, which was not too bad tasting, although it could have passed for a large enchilada at some restaurants. I ordered it not wet, but it came that way and was flat in the box and not overly abundant in meat. My wife had a chicken and a beef taco, and the meat in both was dry and stringy. Some of the chips in the bag were old, (chewy, stale) but the salsa was tasty but watery. Undecided if we'll try them again with all the other choices around.

El Burrito should have a much higher rating. It has a few problems though.

Most of the staff seem very impressed with themselves (with the exception of one very nice older lady who I have seen mentioned in someone else's review elsewhere) and there's general awkwardness thanks to a few messy situations, such as pre-added mandatory tips when using discounts, coupons etc. 

The food tastes good (the deluxe bean dip is spectacular!) but the prices are quite outrageous for Las Vegas. $18 bucks for a plate of Nachos when I can get a larger serving elsewhere for almost a quarter of that price and it would have to be stellar food to win me over.

Worth a look, particularly if you have a coupon, but there's a bit of a weird vibe to the place.

I've been coming to El Burrito since I was in Middle School and it's still one of my favorite homegrown Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas.

I've never really had a bad experience or bad food at this place because I pretty much stick to three things on the menu because each of those items are so good that I just never decided to branch out and try anything else.

The complimentary chips and salsa are always an awesome start to the meal. I usually follow that up with the Noodle Soup. It's pretty salty, but it'll warm you up on a cool night and it tastes great.

I usually get one of three entree plates every time I go, which comes with the aforementioned soup.

1) Two Chicken Burritos w/ Red Sauce
2) Two Tamales
3) Carne Asada

Each of the items comes with the typical fixings, rice and beans and whatnot. Each of the items are equally tasty, and if you get the two burrito plate you will DEFINITELY have leftovers!

I usually cap the meal off with the sopapillas, which are cinnamon-sugar covered pieces of dough that are absolutely delicious. 

:) I highly recommend this place, as a loyal customer for most of my life.

My children and I have been going here for about 12 years, since before my two youngest were born...so obviously we love it. So many things in life have changed and yet our favorite places remain. When I was pregnant with my, now, eleven year old son I craved El Burrito constantly, especially the meatball soup. This same child now loves this soup and craves it as well and has ever since he started eating real food. :)
The food here is traditional "Amurrican" Mexican fare, maybe not authentic but comforting. One thing worth mentioning is that the shredded beef filling for burritos, etc is almost all yummy juicy meat and not dry or full of fillers/onions and peppers or rice and beans. 
We always get the same few things and find the food quality to be very consistent. Service is spotty but friendly. I wish they gave some indication that recognize us when we go there since we always recognize them...and I tip 20%....for 12+ years.
Decor is aging but for some reason I don't care. Lol. It's just that kind of place.
Parking is easy for dinner since they are in a strip mall with businesses that are closed in the evening.

Like: 
*Cheese Nachos + jalapeno's. Sauces on the side.
*Mexican Pizza
*cheese enchilada
*Fajita's (nice and smokey coming to the table)
*Kids Meals

Best:
None of the savory sauces are sweet!
*Shredded Beef Burrito Green Chili style 
*Frozen Margarita...my Favorite in town...strong enough and not too acidic
*Mexican Meatball soup...only made on Fridays

Worst:
Sometimes the cheese on the Nachos is not melted all the way. I hate that!
The "mild" of the house salsa's is too watery and varies in heat level and cilantro flavor.
I wish the chips were warm and salted.
The awful, rubber place mats are often wet! Yuck! 
Eating with kids, I am partial to cloth napkins that are somewhat absorbent...theirs are not.

In all we really like it here and will continue to dine here every few months, probably forever.

Great food. Always consistent and quick. Margaritas are nice and strong. Everything homemade (including both salsas.) Not sure how people below can comment on salsas not being fresh - perhaps they are used to salsa being bland? Overall, great mom and pop place.
Excellent food, also great salsa that comes with the chips. The service could be better, mainly the lack of a host/hostess.

First time here....came in for early dinner on a Friday night.  Seated right away. Chips and salsa were delivered right away. Got drinks ordered and food shortly thereafter. Had #7 two cheese enchiladas. Came with choice of soup or salad.  Had salad with ranch. Good portion size and good salad. The cheese enchiladas were good but a little bland with flavor. I just used some salsa with it to flavor it up. The salsa was chunky and had good flavor too. 

Con: the building is old and kinda smells that way. Not sure if it's the building or all the old people. This restaurant sits at the edge of Del Webb retirement community.

The Stupid places not in Vegas ....probably in United States ..
The Owner is acting weird - He said to everyone in the restaurant to Leave - right now ....  the reason - IAM TO BUSY !!!

there is exactly 3 people in the restaurant !!!

Large, inexpensive portions of tasty Mexican food? Sign me up!

Unfortunately I don't have that much to say about this place because it is what it is; solid Mexican food that really hits the spot once in a while. My only issue was their dessert. The fried ice cream was amazing except for the fact that it was covered in clearly frozen strawberries which ruined everything. Oh well, still solid!

This place use to be great ,But it's gone down hill ,never enough staff. We waited 20 min to get drinks ,got salsa no chips ,no silverware , had to ask for everything , soup was very salty Food was barely ok ,They need better customer service  skills  this place is going downhill
The soup is good, but the service is poor and the prices are too high. Casa Don Juan just opened and I will be trying them next.

We use to go in all the time, and just put up with the bad service cause the food was ok and this place was close. I don't know if the guy with the bad fake hair is the owner or what but he always seems to wait on us. But he has the most miserable attitude I've ever seen! He just seems like he'd rather be somewhere far away. He takes our order and when he drops off either a drink or the food we always say 'thank you' but he NEVER responds with the 'you're welcome" its just a 'uh huh" really? That's the best you can do? We're your only customers right now and you make us feel like we're a bother to you? 
The food itself is just ok, I do like the rice however, the chili rellanos are my preferred choice when we eat there, we've had other servers wait on us and they seem to be pleasant, far more than THAT guy....... We were going in on a regular basis but one time we had the worst service you can imagine, from the food on down, so we didn't go back for years and recently started going back. Not very often but from time to time and "bad hair guy seems to have the same crappy pissed off I hate being here attitude" . I'm really surprised they've stayed open as long as they have due to the little business they have,  every time we've gone in the most we've seen is MAYBE 5 tables at one time , the service was a 2 star at most the food was 4 stars but that's it... it never changes..
I think we'll have to take a break from this place for a while and see if things get better... there are better places than El Burrito, it's just nice cause it's close...

I hate to do this to a local business but taco Tuesday was pain staking! 

Our drinks were okay and the beer was just barely cold. But what hurt the most was the food the tacos we just okay didn't have much flavor in the Salsa and I wanted to send my plate back but I knew the server was doing her best to make sure we were happy. 

I hate having good service but back food because I know the person takin care of us can only do so much. 
Tip to management, revisit some recipes and think about spicing things up. Your a Mexican cantina not Taco Bell people will accept your flavor a are different but will not pay for bland when the drive through is cheaper and comparable

we've been customers of el burrito since they began on decatur and it is so very sad to see what they've become. 

we have had trouble using coupons (the managnent flat out refused to honour them because of a disagreement with the coupon provider)

i was charged $65 for an order and when i got to the restaurant i was treated rudely for using a web based company to place my order. i was told "i've been hanging up on them over and over."

i had to make a second order and contact the company to get a refund. which can only be applied if the company speaks with the restaurant. so i had to make sure the restaurant didn't "hang up on them over and over" again. 

if you have a problem with outside vendors then you work that out with those companies. do not blame your customers. do not inconvenience your customers. 

if a restaurant doesn't respect it's customers, should they receive patronage?

LOVE this place, I've been coming here with my family for years. The noodle soup is to die for and I've been trying to figure out the recipe since I was a kid! I want the recipe bad, so if anyone has a clue of what it may be, email me! wansermom@gmail.com I want that ONE family recipe I can make for years to come! It will be our secret, you have my word!! :)

I have to say I live in California and anytime I come to Vegas.  I visit this place it is the BEST! Love the noodle soup with cheese, chili rellenos and anything with green chili! So happy these local family restaurants still exist!

Possibly the worst mexican place ever. There is a charge for chips after the first bowl. Menu is overpriced. The waitress parks her car right in front. The bus boy parks his motorcycle on the sidewalk next to the windows. The atmosphere is gloomy and outdated. There will not be another visit.

Ok so this review is not so much about the food as the service. I took my mom and my kids here for dinner tonight. We decided we wanted to take the food to go instead of staying there to eat. The guy at the door acted like we wanted him to cater our food right then and there. Smh. We order a beef chimichanga hold the guacamole and sour cream, a chicken chimichanga hold the guacamole and 2 kids chicken fingers (they came with drinks). Here's what we got: 1 beef chimichanga with just meat, a chicken chimichanga with rice and beans (thats fine) and no guacamole or sour cream and two kids meals with no drinks. It may not sound bad to anyone else but for $40 it would be nice to get what I asked for.....

It's been awhile since I tried dining at El Burrito Mexican Restaurant, and my memory of the place was pretty accurate.  It was good food, but not the most amazing service.  I can't remember what happened last time, but this time we had a bunch of weird occurrences.  The wait staff kept changing on us, and they were somewhat awkward.   We got the incorrect amount of change.  Nothing major, so I'll give this place 3 stars.  If their service improved, it'd be a solid 4 star.

Plain and simpe:  Not the best.  I think it's located in the right spot but caters to the elderly crowd who can't separate okay mexican food from great mexican food.  I really do want to support local businesses but it's hard when you're not enjoying yourself.  And if you've tried any kind of mexican dish before, you've had them somewhere else.  The difference, how flexible you can be with the customers.

Chips and salsa are complimentary, they were good.  There were no appetizers that really caught my attention so we skipped on that.  My entree was the chicken chimichanga burrito and my friend had the chicken fajita.  It's always cool when the fajita comes out smoking and hot.  When I asked for my chimichanga to be extra crispy it didn't come out as such.  I asked if they could deep fry it again but was told they couldn't do that, bummer.  They do have regular hamburgers if you're in the mood for something else but your friend or family insist on eating here though.  For dessert we shared a fried ice cream.

And again, what you get here you can get somewhere else for cheaper and with probably fresher produce and a litte bit better service.

The service was slow and inattentive, especially considering there were only 3 tables; she forgot my drink and I had to ask for it again after my food came. I had a chile relleno plate and the food was decent and exactly what I would expect from any other Mexican place. The guacamole was delicious and seemed freshly made in house. The prices are quite high for standard Mexican fare. They've obviously raised the prices to whatever maximum they think Summerlin markets can bear.

Terrible! I had family in town and they said that their friends wanted to go there. I had never heard of it and was making other suggestions, but the friends insisted they go there all the time, know the owners, food's great, etc.
We called ahead because we had a party of 8 and still we waited 15 minutes to be seated. There were dirty glasses of ice water at each place and we could barely get into our seats because the tables were pushed so close together. The chips were stale, unsalted and not homemade and the salsa was unimpressive; one was red and runny with minimal flavor, while the other had huge chunks of stewed tomatoes and a spark of spice. As we were browsing the menu, a waitress came up and asked if we were done with our menus because more people had come in and they didn't have enough...The guacamole was smothered in shredded cheeses and not made at the table, the soup had elbow macaroni and the second round of margaritas came in hot glasses (like they had just come out of the dishwasher). Our meals were disappointing, but we knew they that because there was nothing extraordinary to begin with. The pricing was fair, but the extra 20 minutes it took to get the bill was completely unacceptable. I'll pass next time!
My family and I have been going there as far back as I can remember. It is always amazing food and service!!! Favorite Mexican food in town personally.

Growing up on Mexican cuisine in. So. CA. 
I've sampled good and bad and so so.

El. Burrito is in my neighborhood and my 3 reasons. I love it are:
1.  Very seldom or no waiting for a table..
Ever..
Excellent food.. Totally comfort!!
3.  Large portions. Even for a leftover guy.
4. Nicest staff...
5. Huge Margarita s My wife and. I visit once a week in. Summer. The. Chili  relleno s are as ggo as they get..  Any shredded beef dish is wonderful !!!  Fried. Ice cream ahhh.   Maybe a bit pricey,but worth it.
I enjoyed the Mom & Pop feel and appreciated the genuine smiles in the staffs face. I'm not a Mexican food expert but I greatly enjoyed my food. Feel free to give them a try.

My husband and I went for a motorcycle ride.  We ended up in this part of town.  Not normally somewhere where we'd eat...simply because it is so far from our house.
We split a platter...one beef and one chicken enchilada with rice, beans, chips and salsa.  Really tasty!  Their chunky, pico de gallo salsa is delicious.  Wasn't a huge fan of their hotter salsa.  Reasonable prices and good service.  It hit the spot for our day ride.
If this was closer to us, I'd make it a point of going back there.  Not necessarily good enough to make a 45 minute trek though.
Great food, great service, reasonable prices, easy parking.  Original owner and family since opening in 1992!!!

Worst service ever did not stop at the table and ask how his food was did not ask if we want to drinks did not give a straws or ask if we wanted lemon in the water no season and they charge you two dollars For chips and drinks are not free refills drink very slow shredded lettuce like you would put on the taco for the salad just horrible food then we asked for a drink to go and he told me now we don't do that for lunch also they need to hire more people you have the owner as the server so bad do not eat here

Living in Sun City, EL BURRITO  is right on our corner..Been eating here since they opened on Del Webb many moons ago.... Food is great, so is the service.... Margaritas are perfect.....And for the quality & portions of the dishes, the prices are just right,,,, in fact, my father had an enchilada dish ,that was the same price as the fast food of  Robertos.....and some dishes , like, chimichangas are even CHEAPER than Robertos.....go figure...

This Mexican place is located on and/or near a golf course...? Possibly a retirement community? That is the clientele for sure. It is kind of like a diner in a Midwest town that attracts the olds to have coffee and eat really bland Mexican food at "that one thar Mex-ee-can" place.

The tables have no hot sauce on them. HUH?

The menu does not feature burritos. HUH?

I had an a la carte chicken burrito that didn't come with ANYTHING. No salsa. No sour cream. No guac. HUH? 

I mean, I get that I ordered it a la carte, but not even a dollop of sour cream? Makes you go hmmm. The chicken was sub-standard and didn't have much of a sauce in it. As I sat there eating it I was envisioning a Chipotle burrito I could have gotten for a dollar less and it would have been a thousand times better.

Maybe I should have ordered something different, but for a place called "El Burrito" I was shocked there was not a plethora of burritos to choose from.

I say go to Chipotle over this place if you want EL BURRITO. 

PS - While I was there the US Foodservice truck pulled up and made a delivery. I knew this because he had an employee fill out a form and I watched him get in his truck and drive away. US FOODS you GUYZ. YIKESES.

I love this place and have been going here since I was born! This location hasn't been open that long, but it still has the same food.

It makes me sad to see all the negative reviews on this place, it's really not that bad. In the 25 years that I've been coming to this family restaurant, I've never had a problem with their customer service. This location on Del Webb is a little more quiet and they do have a lot of elderly customers, but everything has been nice and the food still comes out on plates hot from the oven. 

The noodle soup is to die for! Even when it's hot in the summer I still get it because it is so unique.. It's whole wheat macaroni noodles, vegetables, and cilantro in some special kind of broth that I can't figure out. My mom wants to work here just so she can find out the recipe.

Over the years, I've never really deviated from my usual, which is either a cheese enchilada or a guacamole burrito (chicken), usually the lunch special if I can make it here during lunch because it comes with soup or salad and a fountain beverage!!! My parents really enjoy the green chile burritos, but I don't like green chile in general so I can't comment on that. I've also never had their appetizers because I usually fill up on the chips and salsa and the soup.

If you're in the mood for an alcoholic beverage, try the Midori margarita! I'm not sure if it's on the menu, but it's really good... And in my opinion, the bartender that is usually there is very cute and nice. I didn't factor that into my rating!!!

El burrito isn't THE most authentic place (everyone has their own opinions on what's authentic), but I'm Mexican and I still like this place. The only con that I can think of is the hours (doesn't open until noon on Sunday so no breakfast, though they do serve breakfast items) and the chips aren't those greasy fresh hot from the fryer ones that some other restaurants serve. That's okay with me because they are still good. You have to ask for the hot salsa because I guess they are used to catering to people who don't like spicy...and sure the prices have gone up, but so has the cost of food to make the items. 

Believe me or don't believe me, but I will be going to this place until it closes or I die.

I do enjoy going to mom and pop restaurants because you never know what to expect. The Restaurant has a nice view of the mountains when they open their blinds. I experienced one of those beautiful pink and purple sunsets from my seat. 

The dinner started with chips, salsa and we ordered a side of guacamole . The guacamole was good ....you can tell it was home made! The salsa was also delicious! Then they served me some soup with noodles it tasted like salt water to me. I was hoping my shrimp dish would be something savory but it was more salty then anything .My shrimp was served over a red sauce with some Spanish rice. I could only take a few bites and packed the rest to go. 

We ended the dinner with some fried ice cream topped with strawberries and chocolate sauce. It was tasty but I think it would have been better if the strawberries were fresh and not in the compote form (syrupy). 

The environment is cozy but the food was a bit too salty for me .

What a disappointment!!! I paid 62.00 DOLLARS FOR THIS CRAP! I read the first few reviews, I saw the 4 stars and went for it.  What a mistake!i feel taken and I feel like puking. It's not authentic Mexican food.  Im from California where Mexican food is generally good anywhere you go. I though Las Vegas was diverse enough to have some good food by now. There is no cilantro anywhere on the burritos or the tacos.  Meat was flavorless and tough! Salsa is a joke here! Expect pico de gallo with some tomato juice for your salsa.  Enchiladas are the worst, I ate the worst imitation cheese that seems to be a shredded mix of store bought fake cheese! I ordered 2 and ate half of 1, I was to grossed out to eat anymore. The beans are canned, I can go on and on! Horrible, horrible horrible.  My 62.00 dollar order was a pick up order and consisted of 2 carne asada burritos, 2 enchiladas entree and two steak tacos plain for my kids. Rip off!

Great fajitas, the service was really nice and the portions were large. It is now my new favorite neighborhood Mexican place. I think if you stick to either fajitas or combinations, you would do well. The food was really high quality and if you order well, should be enough for a couple more meals at home.

There were mostly older folks there, which I think explains the weird vibe of the place, but it is definitely worth a shot.

Was hesitant going in does the outside was very dark couldn't see in. Was surprised how super friendly and clean it was inside. Larger portions on the food than the normal. Not so authentic Mexican restaurant it's like going to Taco Bell and calling it Mexican food. And just like Taco Bell I ended up sick.

I love dropping in the food is great here but the service is hit and miss. Tonight 3 booths dirty the waitress says we have no booths available . I look at her and since I do not want to sit in the middle of the room I say ok I will make an order to go. After taking my order I ask "so is that booth empty and just needs to be cleaned" well yes it will take 15 minutes. Ok I will wait I really wanted to sit order a beer and relax. Oh my god spend more money maybe leave a tip. I run off to use the bathroom and then come back and the waitress turns and says " I am not ready for you. You are going to have to wait" I waited patiently but seriously could you not show interest... be happy there are people who go want to come in and eat... maybe not.

Meh. That sums up my entire experience at el burrito. The noodle soup was way to salty and nothing else really impressed me. We took Home our leftovers but are planning on tossing those right into the trash. In hindsight I wish I went to Roberto's

Always yummy, guac, beef tacos and although simple they have the best bean and cheese burrito enchilada style. Like their peach Margaritas and Nancy even made me a skinny one today. She said I've never made one but I'll try, it was delish. Ask for Nancy she is so sweet.

So this is a family restaurant that has been in Las Vegas since 1969 and has some food options that can't be found anywhere else in Las Vegas. The nameless, homemade noodle soup with cheese is out of this world. The salsa is homemade and they have two options, one that is hot and one that is more of a chunky salsa, the chips are also homemade and delicious. They also offer lots of different options, with mix and match dinner entrees as well.

Bottom line, you will never satisfy everyone on any aspect but I support family run and small businesses not to mention Las Vegas locals.

The margaritas also are hand poured and are divine. So try it, trust me, you will like it!

Mediocre at best.  My fiance and I ordered our old favorite, chicken fajitas.  The peppers were colorful, but not cooked all the way.  The rice and beans were adequate.

The chips and salsa were not homemade.. AT ALL.  The chips looked like they came from a bag and the salsa was definitely from a jar.  No flavor and nothing special.  

All in all I have yet to experience good Mexican food out here in Vegas and have had better luck back in NY where I came from.

I was dying to try this place and yesterday me and the kids just happened to drive by it so I turned around and was happy we stopped in. Cute little restaurant in a strip mall with full bar. We started off with the free chips and salsa. The chips were seriously the best chips I've had not greasy at all warm, homemade and perfectly salted. The salsa was great fresh and even my little one loved it ! The cheese enchalada is a must one of the best ones I've ever had, and trust me they don't skimp you on the cheese!! Nachos were great! We also had a chicken qausadilla which was awesome. Gooey cheese stuffed with yummy chicken served with sour cream and guacamole. The little one ordered the chicken tenders with fries and I snuck a bite, I know this is Mexican food but the chicken was so good. The service was great and the owner was around checking on tables which I love. He even gave us a free desert to try which was wonderful. I highly recommend this place . I can't wait to go back.

I live nearby and have wanted to give this place a try.  Came in on a Saturday during lunch time ( 12 noon )  We were seated quickly.  It's a cozy little place with a friendly vibe. The server was very nice and attentive.  They have a lunch special with various entrees along with rice and beans and salad or soup and a drink for $10.00 and change.   I had the noodle soup.  It was delicious.  I also tried the chile relleno, very tasty.  I will have to come back here at some point and try their margaritas because they looked good.  :)

Tonight we had fish taco's. They were wonderful !  Lots of avocado inside 2 corn tortilla's with cilantro and green onions ! 
Very yummy !  Husband had a big margarita. This place has a nice welcoming feel to it !  Francesca is a wonderful waitress.  We love the salsa's too !

I frequent El Burrito because I love the food they serve, however, after time after time of HORRIBLE service I refuse to go back. Every single time I've been to This restaurant it takes a minimum of 15-20 minutes for anyone to take our order, and usually there's only 1 other table occupied in the restaurant. I once waited 45 minutes to receive my check while a waitress sat down at a table and decided to watch American idol auditions. The last straw? I went last week, left a tip on my card. And I just looked on my bank account, they added an extra 2 cents on to my tip. I specifically left a total of $30.00 and it was very legible , no room for question. And they had the nerve to add extra money? Absolutely ridiculous. This place should be shut down. I once heard the owner yelling at the cooks in the back saying he wasn't going to pay them that day. This place is a joke.

As a native of Las Vegas, I can say that El Burrito has the best Mexican food in the valley.  I've been going there for the past 31 years when the original location was on Fremont Street.  I live 30 miles from the location in Summerlin, but it is well worth the drive!!!!!  You won't be disappointed.

I used to eat at this restaurant when it was on Decatur and have always been fond of it.  Now that it's in Sun City Summerlin it's a little pricey for lunch, but the food is good.  The crowd is a lot of seniors so it's not a party place and it's American Mexican food but the food quality, portions, service and drinks are all good.  Friendly ambiance too.

This is a definite must try if you are craving Mexican food in the area. Everything is quite delicious, and fresh. I love the fact this restaurant is somewhat health conscious (as much as you can with Mexican food.) They actually use Canola oil in replacement of adding lard, as well as offering other dishes off the menu to cater to those wanting something a little different. All meats are of high quality as well as very fresh sauteed vegetables (try the fajitas.) 

So if you are in the mood for mexican, stop by, check it out and grab a margarita while you are at it. You cannot go wrong here.
I have been coming to El Burrito since I was a little girl! I love that the business has stayed in the family. The soup with cheese is the best!

Man, what happened to this place? Everything tasted canned. Red chili burrito was almost not edible. Tasted like canned stew beef. Chips n salsa not bad. Fried ice cream is premade, and had a freezer burn taste.  Service is slowwww, but food arrives fast. Almost too fast. Makes me feel like nothing is fresh. Disappointed.

I like their food,  and went there regularly, but the quality of service has really tanked. Last time they didn't bring drinks or other items we ordered,  and they didn't  check to see if we needed anything the whole time.  Then they tacked in 20% gratuity because there were 7 of us.  Is that even legal?  It shouldn't be if the service sucks that bad.  I haven't been back since.
